title: Google\Cloud\Datastore\Transaction
name: Transaction
description:
Represents a Transaction

A transaction is a set of Datastore operations on one or more entities. Each transaction is guaranteed to be atomic, which means that transactions are never partially applied. Either all of the operations in the transaction are applied, or none of them are applied.

It is highly recommended that users read and understand the underlying concepts in Transactions before beginning.

Mutations (i.e. insert, update and delete) are not executed immediately. Calls to those methods (and their batch equivalents) will enqueue a new mutation. Calling Google\Cloud\Datastore\Transaction::commit() will execute all the mutationsin the order they were enqueued, and end the transaction.

Lookups and queries can be run in a transaction, so long as they are run prior to committing or rolling back the transaction.

Transactions are an optional feature of Google Cloud Datastore. Queries, lookups and mutations can be executed outside of a Transaction from Google\Cloud\Datastore\DatastoreClient.

methods.name: insert
methods.description:
Insert an entity

No service requests are run when this method is called. Use Google\Cloud\Datastore\Transaction::commit() to commit changes.

methods.name: insertBatch
methods.description:
Insert multiple entities

No service requests are run when this method is called. Use Google\Cloud\Datastore\Transaction::commit() to commit changes.

methods.name: update
methods.description:
Update an entity

No service requests are run when this method is called. Use Google\Cloud\Datastore\Transaction::commit() to commit changes.

params.name: options.allowOverwrite
params.description: Entities must be updated as an entire resource. Patch operations are not supported. Because entities can be created manually, or obtained by a lookup or query, it is possible to accidentally overwrite an existing record with a new one when manually creating an entity. To provide additional safety, this flag must be set to true in order to update a record when the entity provided was not obtained through a lookup or query. Defaults to false.

methods.name: updateBatch
methods.description:
Update multiple entities

No service requests are run when this method is called. Use Google\Cloud\Datastore\Transaction::commit() to commit changes.

params.name: options.allowOverwrite
params.description: Entities must be updated as an entire resource. Patch operations are not supported. Because entities can be created manually, or obtained by a lookup or query, it is possible to accidentally overwrite an existing record with a new one when manually creating an entity. To provide additional safety, this flag must be set to true in order to update a record when the entity provided was not obtained through a lookup or query. Defaults to false.

methods.name: upsert
methods.description:
Upsert an entity

No service requests are run when this method is called. Use Google\Cloud\Datastore\Transaction::commit() to commit changes.

Upsert will create a record if one does not already exist, or overwrite existing record if one already exists.

methods.name: upsertBatch
methods.description:
Upsert multiple entities

No service requests are run when this method is called. Use Google\Cloud\Datastore\Transaction::commit() to commit changes.

Upsert will create a record if one does not already exist, or overwrite existing record if one already exists.

methods.name: delete
methods.description:
Delete a record

No service requests are run when this method is called. Use Google\Cloud\Datastore\Transaction::commit() to commit changes.

methods.name: deleteBatch
methods.description:
Delete multiple records

No service requests are run when this method is called. Use Google\Cloud\Datastore\Transaction::commit() to commit changes.

methods.name: lookup
methods.description: Retrieve an entity from the datastore inside a transaction

params.name: key
params.description: $key The identifier to use to locate a desired entity.

params.name: options.className
params.description: The name of the class to return results as. Must be a subclass of Google\Cloud\Datastore\Entity. If not set, Google\Cloud\Datastore\Entity will be used.

params.name: options.className
params.description: If a string, the name of the class to return results as. Must be a subclass of Google\Cloud\Datastore\Entity. If not set, Google\Cloud\Datastore\Entity will be used. If an array is given, it must be an associative array, where the key is a Kind and the value is the name of a subclass of Google\Cloud\Datastore\Entity.

params.name: options.sort
params.description: If set to true, results in each set will be sorted to match the order given in $keys. Defaults to false.

returns.description: Returns an array with keys [found, missing, and deferred]. Members of found will be instance of Google\Cloud\Datastore\Entity. Members of missing and deferred will be instance of Google\Cloud\Datastore\Key.

methods.name: runQuery
methods.description: Run a query and return entities inside a Transaction

params.name: options.className
params.description: The name of the class to return results as. Must be a subclass of Google\Cloud\Datastore\Entity. If not set, Google\Cloud\Datastore\Entity will be used.

methods.name: commit
methods.description:
Commit all mutations

Calling this method will end the operation (and close the transaction, if one is specified).
